Name: Including menstrual cups in the definition of menstrual products and the provision of such products.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including menstrual cups in the definition of menstrual products and the provision of such products
BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity

This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 25, 2023
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor

Summary: This bill would define the term “menstrual products” as menstrual cups, tampons, and pads, for purposes of the administrative code. This bill would also require the Department of Citywide Administrative Services to include menstrual cups in the provision of menstrual products to agencies, for further distribution to individuals in temporary shelters, and youth in secure detention or congregate care facilities. Additionally, this bill would require the Department of Correction to provide all incarcerated individuals who menstruate with either reusable or single use menstrual cups as soon as practicable upon request.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 1-112 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision 23 to read as follows:
      23. "Menstrual products." Menstrual cups, tampons, and menstrual pads for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      � 2.  Section 9-141 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by a local law for the year 2023 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to requiring the department of correction to report on the distribution of menstrual products in city correctional facilities, as proposed in introduction number 1057-A, is amended to read as follows:
      � 9-141 Menstrual products. a. Definitions. As used in this section, the following terms have the following meanings:
      Commissioner. The term "commissioner" means the commissioner of correction. 
      Department. The term "department" means the department of correction. 
      Menstrual cup. The term "menstrual cup" means a funnel-shaped or disc-shaped device made of either reusable or single-use material for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      b. Distribution of menstrual products. 1. All incarcerated individuals in the custody of the department who are in need of menstrual products shall be provided, at the department's expense, with menstrual products as soon as practicable upon request. All individuals arrested and detained in the custody of the department for at least 48 hours who are in need of menstrual products shall be provided, at the department's expense, with menstrual products as soon as practicable upon request. [For purposes of this section, "menstrual products" means tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.] 
      2. The department shall provide a reusable menstrual cup, at the department's expense, to any person who requests such cup upon release from the department's custody.
      [b.] c. Reporting on provision of menstrual products. 1. No later than July 31, 2025, and annually thereafter, the commissioner shall submit to the mayor and the speaker of the council and post on the department's website a report on the provision of menstrual products, as required by subdivision a of this section, during the preceding fiscal year. Such report shall include the following information:
      (a) The average daily population of individuals in the custody of the department, disaggregated by gender;
      (b) The number of such products ordered by the department during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type; 
      (c) The number of such products distributed to city correctional facilities during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type; and
      (d) The number of such products distributed to individuals in the custody of the department during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type. 
      � 3. Section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:
      � 12-207 Availability of [feminine hygiene] menstrual products. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:
      Menstrual cup. The term "menstrual cup" means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      [Feminine hygiene] Menstrual products. The term "[feminine hygiene] menstrual products" means menstrual cups, tampons, and [sanitary napkins] menstrual pads for use in connection with the menstrual cycle. 
      Temporary shelters. The term "temporary shelters" means department of homeless services family with children shelters, adult family shelters, single adult women shelters and single adult men shelters; and human resources administration domestic violence shelters and HIV/AIDS services administration (HASA) shelters. 
      b. The department of citywide administrative services shall make available to agencies operating or having oversight of providers operating temporary shelters a supply of [feminine hygiene] menstrual products sufficient to meet the needs of residents. The department shall also make available a supply of [feminine hygiene] menstrual products sufficient to meet the needs of youth in secure detention facilities operated by the administration for children's services, as well as youth in congregate care facilities operated by the administration for children's services who are awaiting placement with a licensed foster care agency.
      � 4. This local law takes effect on the same date as a local law for the year 2023 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to requiring the department of correction to report on the distribution of menstrual products in city correctional facilities, as proposed in introduction number 1057-A, takes effect.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. \cf1 Section 1-112 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision 23 to read as follows:\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 23. \ldblquote Menstrual products.\rdblquote  Menstrual cups, tampons, and menstrual pads for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24\'a7 2.  Section 9-141 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by a local law for the year 2023 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to requiring the department of correction to report on the distribution of menstrual products in city correctional facilities, as proposed in introduction number 1057-A, is amended to read as follows:\fs27\par
\fs24\'a7 9-141 Menstrual products. a. \ul Definitions. As used in this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Commissioner. The term \ldblquote commissioner\rdblquote  means the commissioner of correction. \par
Department. The term \ldblquote department\rdblquote  means the department of correction. \ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Menstrual cup. The term \ldblquote menstrual cup\rdblquote  means a funnel-shaped or disc-shaped device made of either reusable or single-use material for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\par
b. Distribution of menstrual products. 1.\ulnone  All incarcerated individuals in the custody of the department who are in need of menstrual products shall be provided, at the department\rquote s expense, with \cf0 menstrual\cf1  products as soon as practicable upon request. All individuals arrested and detained in the custody of the department for at least 48 hours who are in need of menstrual products shall be provided, at the department\rquote s expense, with menstrual products as soon as practicable upon request. [For purposes of this section, \ldblquote menstrual products\rdblquote  means tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.]\ul  \par
2. The department shall provide a reusable menstrual cup, at the department\rquote s expense, to any person who requests such cup upon release from the department\rquote s custody.\par
\ulnone [b.] \ul c.\ulnone  Reporting on provision of menstrual products. 1. No later than July 31, 2025, and annually thereafter, the commissioner shall submit to the mayor and the speaker of the council and post on the department\rquote s website a report on the provision of menstrual products, as required by subdivision a of this section, during the preceding fiscal year. Such report shall include the following information:\fs27\par
\fs24 (a) The average daily population of individuals in the custody of the department, disaggregated by gender;\fs27\par
\fs24 (b) The number of such products ordered by the department during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type; \fs27\par
\fs24 (c) The number of such products distributed to city correctional facilities during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type; and\par
(d) The number of such products distributed to individuals in the custody of the department during the preceding 12 months, disaggregated by product type. \par
\'a7 3. Section 12-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 83 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:\par
\'a7 12-207 Availability of [feminine hygiene] \ul menstrual\ulnone  products. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
\ul Menstrual cup. The term \ldblquote menstrual cup\rdblquote  means a funnel-shaped device made of a reusable material such as silicone or rubber for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.\ulnone\par
[Feminine hygiene] \ul Menstrual\ulnone  products. The term \ldblquote [feminine hygiene] \ul menstrual\ulnone  products\rdblquote  means \ul menstrual cups,\ulnone  tampons\ul ,\ulnone  and [sanitary napkins] \ul menstrual pads\ulnone  for use in connection with the menstrual cycle. \ul\par
\ulnone Temporary shelters. The term \ldblquote temporary shelters\rdblquote  means department of homeless services family with children shelters, adult family shelters, single adult women shelters and single adult men shelters; and human resources administration domestic violence shelters and HIV/AIDS services administration (HASA) shelters. \par
b. The department of citywide administrative services shall make available to agencies operating or having oversight of providers operating temporary shelters a supply of [feminine hygiene] \ul menstrual\ulnone  products sufficient to meet the needs of residents. The department shall also make available a supply of [feminine hygiene] \ul menstrual\ulnone  products sufficient to meet the needs of youth in secure detention facilities operated by the administration for children\rquote s services, as well as youth in congregate care facilities operated by the administration for children\rquote s services who are awaiting placement with a licensed foster care agency.\fs27\par
\fs24\'a7 4. This local law takes effect on the same date as a local law for the year 2023 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to requiring the department of correction to report on the distribution of menstrual products in city correctional facilities, as proposed in introduction number 1057-A, takes effect.  \fs27\par
